intro: Cynoglossum asperum, commonly known as horseweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry meadows. Cynoglossum asperum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
